27#ifndef HB_OT_POST_TABLE_HH
28#define HB_OT_POST_TABLE_HH
29
30#include "hb-open-type.hh"
31#include "hb-ot-var-mvar-table.hh"
32
33#define HB_STRING_ARRAY_NAME format1_names
34#define HB_STRING_ARRAY_LIST "hb-ot-post-macroman.hh"
35#include "hb-string-array.hh"
36#undef HB_STRING_ARRAY_LIST
37#undef HB_STRING_ARRAY_NAME
38
39/*
40 * post -- PostScript
41 * https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/post
42 */
43#define HB_OT_TAG_post HB_TAG('p','o','s','t')
44
45
46namespace OT {
47
48
49struct postV2Tail
50{
51 friend struct post;
52
53 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
54 {
55 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
56 return_trace (glyphNameIndex.sanitize (c));
57 }
58
59 template<typename Iterator>
60 bool serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c,
61 Iterator it,
62 const void* _post) const;
63
64 bool subset (hb_subset_context_t *c) const;
65
66 protected:
67 Array16Of<HBUINT16> glyphNameIndex; /* This is not an offset, but is the
68 * ordinal number of the glyph in 'post'
69 * string tables. */
70/*UnsizedArrayOf<HBUINT8>
71 namesX;*/ /* Glyph names with length bytes [variable]
72 * (a Pascal string). */
73
74 public:
75 DEFINE_SIZE_ARRAY (2, glyphNameIndex);
76};
77
78struct post
79{
80 static constexpr hb_tag_t tableTag = HB_OT_TAG_post;
81
82 bool serialize (hb_serialize_context_t *c, bool glyph_names) const
83 {
84 TRACE_SERIALIZE (this);
85 post *post_prime = c->allocate_min<post> ();
86 if (unlikely (!post_prime)) return_trace (false);
87
88 hb_memcpy (dst: post_prime, src: this, len: post::min_size);
89 if (!glyph_names)
90 return_trace (c->check_assign (post_prime->version.major, 3,
91 HB_SERIALIZE_ERROR_INT_OVERFLOW)); // Version 3 does not have any glyph names.
92
93 return_trace (true);
94 }
95
96 bool subset (hb_subset_context_t *c) const
97 {
98 TRACE_SUBSET (this);
99 post *post_prime = c->serializer->start_embed<post> ();
100 if (unlikely (!post_prime)) return_trace (false);
101
102#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
103 if (c->plan->normalized_coords)
104 {
105 auto &MVAR = *c->plan->source->table.MVAR;
106 auto *table = post_prime;
107
108 HB_ADD_MVAR_VAR (HB_OT_METRICS_TAG_UNDERLINE_SIZE, underlineThickness);
109 HB_ADD_MVAR_VAR (HB_OT_METRICS_TAG_UNDERLINE_OFFSET, underlinePosition);
110 }
111#endif
112
113 bool glyph_names = c->plan->flags & HB_SUBSET_FLAGS_GLYPH_NAMES;
114 if (!serialize (c: c->serializer, glyph_names))
115 return_trace (false);
116
117 if (c->plan->user_axes_location.has (HB_TAG ('s','l','n','t')) &&
118 !c->plan->pinned_at_default)
119 {
120 float italic_angle = c->plan->user_axes_location.get (HB_TAG ('s','l','n','t'));
121 italic_angle = hb_max (-90.f, hb_min (italic_angle, 90.f));
122 post_prime->italicAngle.set_float (italic_angle);
123 }
124
125 if (glyph_names && version.major == 2)
126 return_trace (v2X.subset (c));
127
128 return_trace (true);
129 }
130
131 struct accelerator_t
132 {
133 friend struct postV2Tail;
134
135 accelerator_t (hb_face_t *face)
136 {
137 table = hb_sanitize_context_t ().reference_table<post> (face);
138 unsigned int table_length = table.get_length ();
139
140 version = table->version.to_int ();
141 if (version != 0x00020000) return;
142
143 const postV2Tail &v2 = table->v2X;
144
145 glyphNameIndex = &v2.glyphNameIndex;
146 pool = &StructAfter<uint8_t> (X: v2.glyphNameIndex);
147
148 const uint8_t *end = (const uint8_t *) (const void *) table + table_length;
149 index_to_offset.alloc (size: hb_min (face->get_num_glyphs (), table_length / 8));
150 for (const uint8_t *data = pool;
151 index_to_offset.length < 65535 && data < end && data + *data < end;
152 data += 1 + *data)
153 index_to_offset.push (v: data - pool);
154 }
155 ~accelerator_t ()
156 {
157 hb_free (ptr: gids_sorted_by_name.get_acquire ());
158 table.destroy ();
159 }
160
161 bool get_glyph_name (hb_codepoint_t glyph,
162 char *buf, unsigned int buf_len) const
163 {
164 hb_bytes_t s = find_glyph_name (glyph);
165 if (!s.length) return false;
166 if (!buf_len) return true;
167 unsigned int len = hb_min (buf_len - 1, s.length);
168 strncpy (dest: buf, src: s.arrayZ, n: len);
169 buf[len] = '\0';
170 return true;
171 }
172
173 bool get_glyph_from_name (const char *name, int len,
174 hb_codepoint_t *glyph) const
175 {
176 unsigned int count = get_glyph_count ();
177 if (unlikely (!count)) return false;
178
179 if (len < 0) len = strlen (s: name);
180
181 if (unlikely (!len)) return false;
182
183 retry:
184 uint16_t *gids = gids_sorted_by_name.get_acquire ();
185
186 if (unlikely (!gids))
187 {
188 gids = (uint16_t *) hb_malloc (size: count * sizeof (gids[0]));
189 if (unlikely (!gids))
190 return false; /* Anything better?! */
191
192 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
193 gids[i] = i;
194 hb_qsort (base: gids, nel: count, width: sizeof (gids[0]), compar: cmp_gids, arg: (void *) this);
195
196 if (unlikely (!gids_sorted_by_name.cmpexch (nullptr, gids)))
197 {
198 hb_free (ptr: gids);
199 goto retry;
200 }
201 }
202
203 hb_bytes_t st (name, len);
204 auto* gid = hb_bsearch (key: st, base: gids, nmemb: count, stride: sizeof (gids[0]), compar: cmp_key, ds: (void *) this);
205 if (gid)
206 {
207 *glyph = *gid;
208 return true;
209 }
210
211 return false;
212 }
213
214 hb_blob_ptr_t<post> table;
215
216 protected:
217
218 unsigned int get_glyph_count () const
219 {
220 if (version == 0x00010000)
221 return format1_names_length;
222
223 if (version == 0x00020000)
224 return glyphNameIndex->len;
225
226 return 0;
227 }
228
229 static int cmp_gids (const void *pa, const void *pb, void *arg)
230 {
231 const accelerator_t *thiz = (const accelerator_t *) arg;
232 uint16_t a = * (const uint16_t *) pa;
233 uint16_t b = * (const uint16_t *) pb;
234 return thiz->find_glyph_name (glyph: b).cmp (a: thiz->find_glyph_name (glyph: a));
235 }
236
237 static int cmp_key (const void *pk, const void *po, void *arg)
238 {
239 const accelerator_t *thiz = (const accelerator_t *) arg;
240 const hb_bytes_t *key = (const hb_bytes_t *) pk;
241 uint16_t o = * (const uint16_t *) po;
242 return thiz->find_glyph_name (glyph: o).cmp (a: *key);
243 }
244
245 hb_bytes_t find_glyph_name (hb_codepoint_t glyph) const
246 {
247 if (version == 0x00010000)
248 {
249 if (glyph >= format1_names_length)
250 return hb_bytes_t ();
251
252 return format1_names (i: glyph);
253 }
254
255 if (version != 0x00020000 || glyph >= glyphNameIndex->len)
256 return hb_bytes_t ();
257
258 unsigned int index = glyphNameIndex->arrayZ[glyph];
259 if (index < format1_names_length)
260 return format1_names (i: index);
261 index -= format1_names_length;
262
263 if (index >= index_to_offset.length)
264 return hb_bytes_t ();
265 unsigned int offset = index_to_offset[index];
266
267 const uint8_t *data = pool + offset;
268 unsigned int name_length = *data;
269 data++;
270
271 return hb_bytes_t ((const char *) data, name_length);
272 }
273
274 private:
275 uint32_t version;
276 const Array16Of<HBUINT16> *glyphNameIndex = nullptr;
277 hb_vector_t<uint32_t> index_to_offset;
278 const uint8_t *pool = nullptr;
279 hb_atomic_ptr_t<uint16_t *> gids_sorted_by_name;
280 };
281
282 bool has_data () const { return version.to_int (); }
283
284 bool sanitize (hb_sanitize_context_t *c) const
285 {
286 TRACE_SANITIZE (this);
287 return_trace (c->check_struct (this) &&
288 (version.to_int () == 0x00010000 ||
289 (version.to_int () == 0x00020000 && v2X.sanitize (c)) ||
290 version.to_int () == 0x00030000));
291 }
292
293 public:
294 FixedVersion<>version; /* 0x00010000 for version 1.0
295 * 0x00020000 for version 2.0
296 * 0x00025000 for version 2.5 (deprecated)
297 * 0x00030000 for version 3.0 */
298 F16DOT16 italicAngle; /* Italic angle in counter-clockwise degrees
299 * from the vertical. Zero for upright text,
300 * negative for text that leans to the right
301 * (forward). */
302 FWORD underlinePosition; /* This is the suggested distance of the top
303 * of the underline from the baseline
304 * (negative values indicate below baseline).
305 * The PostScript definition of this FontInfo
306 * dictionary key (the y coordinate of the
307 * center of the stroke) is not used for
308 * historical reasons. The value of the
309 * PostScript key may be calculated by
310 * subtracting half the underlineThickness
311 * from the value of this field. */
312 FWORD underlineThickness; /* Suggested values for the underline
313 thickness. */
314 HBUINT32 isFixedPitch; /* Set to 0 if the font is proportionally
315 * spaced, non-zero if the font is not
316 * proportionally spaced (i.e. monospaced). */
317 HBUINT32 minMemType42; /* Minimum memory usage when an OpenType font
318 * is downloaded. */
319 HBUINT32 maxMemType42; /* Maximum memory usage when an OpenType font
320 * is downloaded. */
321 HBUINT32 minMemType1; /* Minimum memory usage when an OpenType font
322 * is downloaded as a Type 1 font. */
323 HBUINT32 maxMemType1; /* Maximum memory usage when an OpenType font
324 * is downloaded as a Type 1 font. */
325 postV2Tail v2X;
326 DEFINE_SIZE_MIN (32);
327};
328
329struct post_accelerator_t : post::accelerator_t {
330 post_accelerator_t (hb_face_t *face) : post::accelerator_t (face) {}
331};
332
333
334} /* namespace OT */
335
336
337#endif /* HB_OT_POST_TABLE_HH */
